message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the behavior of a candle when it is lit. When a candle is lit, the flame melts the wax at the top of the candle, causing it to burn and evaporate. As the wax is burned, the candle gradually gets shorter in height. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) it gets shorter. Option (A) is incorrect because the candle does change in height. Option (B) is also incorrect because the candle does not stay the same. Option (D) is incorrect because the candle does not get taller when it is lit.

This question tests basic knowledge about candles and the effects of lighting them. When a candle is lit, the heat from the flame melts the wax, causing it to evaporate and release gases. As the wax evaporates, the candle gradually gets shorter. Therefore, the correct answer is option (C), it gets shorter. Option (A) is incorrect because the candle does not stay the same. Option (B) is also incorrect because the candle does not have no effect when it is lit. Option (D) is incorrect because the candle does not get taller when it is lit.

This question requires basic knowledge about the behavior of a candle when it is lit. When a candle is lit, the wax begins to melt and the wick starts to burn. As the wick burns, it gets shorter because it is consumed by the flame. Therefore, option (C) is the correct answer. Option (A) is incorrect because the height of the candle changes when it is lit. Option (B) is incorrect because one of the options must be chosen. Option (D) is incorrect because the candle does not get taller when it is lit.

This question requires basic knowledge about what happens when a candle is lit. When a candle is lit, the heat from the flame melts the wax near the wick. This melted wax is then drawn up the wick and vaporizes, creating a flame. As the wax is consumed by the flame, the candle gets shorter. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) it gets shorter. Option (A) is incorrect because the candle does not stay the same. Option (B) is also incorrect because the candle does not remain unchanged. Option (D) is incorrect because the candle does not get taller when it is lit.

This question requires basic knowledge about how candles work. When a candle is lit, the heat of the flame melts the wax near the wick and turns it into vapor. This vapor then combines with oxygen in the air to create a reaction that produces heat, light, water vapor, and carbon dioxide. As the wax near the wick is consumed, the candle gets shorter. Therefore, option (C), "it gets shorter," is the correct answer. Option (A), "it stays same," is incorrect because the candle does change as it burns. Option (B), "none of these," is incorrect because one of the options must be correct. Option (D), "it gets taller," is incorrect because as the wax is consumed, the candle becomes shorter, not taller.

As the wax melts, it is drawn up the wick and is burned, causing the candle to get shorter over time. Option (A) is incorrect because the candle does not stay the same when it is lit. Option (B) is incorrect because the candle does not stay the same and does not have a change in height. Option (D) is incorrect because the candle does not get taller when it is lit.

Option (A) is incorrect because the candle does not stay the same. Option (B) is not correct because the candle does undergo a physical change when it is lit. Option (D) is incorrect because the candle does not get taller when it is lit.
